data.text:
Alcohol and drug rehab treatment in Kettering

Substance Abuse Statistics near Kettering, Northamptonshire

Kettering has a major problem with drug dealing, which many, including the local authorities, believe happens in the open. It has been well-documented that the country had 16 lines which have been able to thrive to date due to the constant demand.

Besides having the highest number of drug-related crimes, alcohol abuse statistics in Kettering are equally high. A 2020 report stated that the highest rates of alcohol-related hospital admissions in Northamptonshire were in Kettering and the nearby towns of Corby and Northampton.

While these numbers may be worrying for residents of Kettering, you need not worry. UKAT rehab facilities near Kettering provide residential options and customised treatment plans for your loved ones.

Why Choose Banbury Lodge for Drug and Alcohol Rehab near Kettering, Northamptonshire?

UKAT has several rehab centres across the UK. You can choose to enrol at Oasis Runcorn, Oasis Bradford, Liberty House, Recovery Lighthouse, Sanctuary Lodge, Linwood House or Primrose Lodge for your rehab journey.

Banbury Lodge is a private rehab clinic near Kettering. This centre is well-equipped and ensures a safe treatment environment under a trained team of experts.

Banbury Lodge has an enviable central location, making it easily accessible from most towns and cities around London and guarantees a warm and welcoming environment. This rehab centre is 45.5 miles from Kettering via A43 and the drive can take approximately 1 hour and 10 minutes.

Banbury Lodge offers a positive and comfortable environment. This rehab centre near Kettering is spacious with peaceful communal spaces. This centre is open 24 hours and assures immediate admission.

Other features of Banbury Lodge include:

22 en-suite bedrooms

Fully-trained staff is available 24×7

Free lifetime aftercare

Large luxurious grounds with tranquil surroundings

Accepts private insurance

Treats eating disorders

Virtual Tour of Banbury Lodge

Banbury Lodge offers a state-of-the-art rehab facility, and the pictures of the centre are proof of the same. You can also take a virtual tour of the facility.

Treatment Options at Banbury Lodge

At Banbury Lodge, the staff understands that the treatment and therapies offered at a rehab centre form the foundation for an individual’s recovery journey. The centre offers a wide range of treatment options for alcohol and drug addictions.

Some of these include:

12-Step therapy

Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT)

Art Therapy

Dialectic Behavioural Therapy (DBT)

Individual or one-to-one therapy

Group therapies

Banbury Lodge near Kettering: What Makes it Popular with Clients?

Due to its warm and safe environment and trained staff, Banbury Lodge rehab centre has been able to help people from various walks of life fight and overcome their addictions. Here’s what people have to say about this residential rehab near Kettering:

“My experience overall was fantastic, I enjoyed all group sessions, the centre and found the staff amazing. Thank you all!”- PH

“Fantastic stay and recovery service. Sonia my therapist was absolutely brilliant”- Tommy Hassal

“Banbury Lodge was great all around, the staff are all lovely and their community are so welcoming.”- Mh

Travelling to Banbury Lodge from Kettering

Kettering is a market and industrial town located in north Northamptonshire, 67 miles from London. The town grew due to the boot and shoe industry which the entire county was famous for. The town is famous for various companies, including Pegasus Software, RCI Europe, Aryzta, Timsons Ltd., etc. Kettering is also known for Wicksteed Park, UK’s second-oldest theme park.

Here’s how you can travel from Kettering to Banbury Lodge:

By road: The fastest route by road from Kettering to Banbury Lodge rehab centre is via A43. It takes about 1 hour and 10 minutes to traverse the distance of 45.5 miles. The other two routes are via A14 and A361.

By train: The average time to travel from Kettering to Banbury Lodge is around 3 hours and 10 minutes. The earliest train from Newlands Centre is at 5:14 am and you will need to change one or two trains to get to Banbury Lodge.
